name: Queer Asian Women & Transgender Support (QAWTS)
description: Queer Asian Women and Transgender Support (QAWTS) Program is a community-centered training, dialogue, and skills-building for queer relationships, and Homophobia Busters trains and activates cohorts of anti-homophobia allies within Asian Pacific Islander (API) immigrant communities.
fullDescription: Queer Asian Women and Transgender Support (QAWTS) Program is a community-centered training, dialogue, and skills-building for queer relationships, and Homophobia Busters trains and activates cohorts of anti-homophobia allies within Asian Pacific Islander (API) immigrant communities.
whatTheyOffer: Queer Asian Women and Transgender Support (QAWTS) Program has a two-part prevention model. The two program components include: - Chai Chats is a 6-session cycle of community-centered training, dialogue, and skills-building for queer relationships. Chai Chats is also available in the East Bay. - Homophobia Busters trains and activates cohorts of anti-homophobia allies within Asian Pacific Islander (API) immigrant and refugee communities. Locations: Asian Pacific Islander Legal Outreach (APILO), B
howToGetIt: All services are available by appointment. Call main line (415) 751-7110 for appointment. For crisis, please call 24/7 - (877) 751-0880
